comment.author: 31821335@N02
comment._content:
After contacting the Information Centre in Iceland I can now identify this building
The house was built in 1916, and a third story added in 1930. The buildings address is
Kirkjustraeti 2, Reykjavik, Iceland. It was The Salvation Army House in Iceland and it is still
owned the them. The Architect was Einar Erlendsson (1883-1968). This information comes from The Curator, Reykajavik City Museum.  helga.maureen.gylfadottir@reykjavik.is
comment.authorname: richwall100 - Thank you all for 1,000,000 views

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: richwall100: Thank you very much for identifying and locating the building and giving us all this interesting information, derived from Helga Maureen Gylfadottir at the Reykajavik City Museum. (Thank You Helga !). I have added the information to our photo database. Perhaps Berit Wallenberg stayed at this house when visiting Reykjavik - it was exactly the kind of accomodation she preferred while travelling. Here is the homepage of the Salvation Army Guesthouse /Anna B.
